{"step_by_step_thinking": "Luting cement is used in dentistry to adhere a dental prosthesis to tooth structure or to each other. The thickness of luting cement is important because it can affect the fit and retention of the prosthesis. According to dental standards, the ideal thickness of luting cement should be around 25 micrometers, which falls within the range of 20-40 micrometers.", "answer_choice": "A"}
